This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=EPC-MEMBERS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-01-05T13:30:23Z Engineering Professors' Council 2015-01-05T13:28:16+00:00 2015-01-05T13:28:16+00:00 DEADLINE REMINDER - Still chance for your students to win \ufffd\ufffd1k https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;66014e6c.1501 A very happy new year to you all<br><br>Just a quick reminder that our student essay competition closes on 9th January, 2015. Open to postgraduate and undergraduate engineering students alike, there's a first prize of \ufffd\ufffd1k and two runner-up prizes of \ufffd\ufffd500 each on offer. Full details of how to enter available here: http://epc.ac.uk/20th-anniversary-awards-2015/. [...] Engineering Professors' Council 2014-12-18T10:05:01+00:00 2014-12-18T10:05:01+00:00 Fixing broken newsletter link... https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;1611909c.1412 Dear all<br><br>My apologies but the link provided in the the last message regarding our latest newsletter doesn't seem to work...Cutting and pasting the address given into your web browser would have taken you to it but clicking directly on it would not. The following should now work...<br><br>http://www.flipsnack.com/A77F6DAD75E/engineering-professors-council-newsletter-dec-2014-ref-editio.html<br><br>Apologies once again. Don't forget to log into the Members' Portal for a round-up of the REF for engineering... [...] Engineering Professors' Council 2014-12-18T00:11:15+00:00 2014-12-18T00:11:15+00:00 Winter newsletter - REF edition...and some admin... https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;fb33fc22.1412 Dear Member<br><br>Engineering Professors\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Council newsletter: REF2014 Edition...and some end-of-year admin<br><br>As you contemplate the results of the Research Excellence Framework 2014, we hope you'll find the link to the latest Engineering Professors\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Council (EPC) newsletter for winter 2014 useful, as it contains an overview of the results for engineering and details of our \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdREF comparison tool\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd which may be accessed via the Members\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Portal on our website. [...] Susan Kay 2014-12-12T11:42:22+00:00 2014-12-12T11:42:22+00:00 infoDigest - 12 December, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;5f85c3f0.1412 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;5f85c3f0.1412">infoDigest - 12 December, 2014 </a> Engineering Professors' Council 2014-11-12T15:43:21+00:00 2014-11-12T15:43:21+00:00 infoDigest - 12 Nov, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;73257d78.1411 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;73257d78.1411">infoDigest - 12 Nov, 2014 </a> Engineering Professors' Council 2014-10-23T10:51:13+01:00 2014-10-23T10:51:13+01:00 infoDigest - 23 October, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;11aee5f0.1410 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;11aee5f0.1410">infoDigest - 23 October, 2014 </a> Engineering Professors' Council 2014-10-17T17:11:41+01:00 2014-10-17T17:11:41+01:00 Views on development of an "international REF" invited https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;e4e2c43d.1410 Dear Colleagues<br><br>HEFCE is currently running a survey inviting views on developing an internationalised system of research assessment. Please could you take 5 minutes of your time to respond to 3 multiple choice questions so we may reply on behalf of the Engineering Professors' Council...<br><br>Enter the poll: http://epc.ac.uk/views-on-an-international-ref-invited/<br><br>Professor Stephanie Haywood<br><br>Chair of the Research, Innovation and Knowledge Transfer sub committee [...] Susan Kay 2014-10-06T15:21:25+01:00 2014-10-06T15:21:25+01:00 infoDigest - 6 October, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;a0f9c53c.1410 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;a0f9c53c.1410">infoDigest - 6 October, 2014 </a> Susan Kay 2014-09-29T09:47:32+01:00 2014-09-29T09:47:32+01:00 Action needed - early enrolments poll and event information https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;a0b0c5a6.1409 Dear colleague<br><br>Early enrolments poll<br><br>**Please do take part: deadline 24 October, 2014**<br><br>For the last two years, we have asked you to complete a short survey to enable us - in advance of publication of the "official" data which is usually 18 months after the event - to assess the situation regarding enrolments to engineering programmes in UK universities at both undergraduate and postgraduate taught levels. The results have been collated, anonymised and fed back at the EPC's Annual Recruitment and Admissions Fora. The results have attracted a lot of attention in both the media and with the funding [...] Susan Kay 2014-09-12T13:45:23+01:00 2014-09-12T13:45:23+01:00 Fw: UUK Panel invites evidence on student fees and loans system in England - CORRECTION https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;8f902649.1409 With apologies \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd the correct link to the questionnaire is as follows:<br><br>http://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Studentfunding<br><br>E: s.kay@epc.ac.uk<br>W: http://epc.ac.uk<br><br>From: Engineering Professors' Council (EPC)<br>Sent: Friday, September 12, 2014 12:56 PM<br>To: EPC-MEMBERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: UUK Panel invites evidence on student fees and loans system in England<br><br>Dear colleagues<br><br>Please forgive yet another request for you to complete a questionnaire...I'm afraid we're running into "consultation season" - probably inevitable in the run-up to next year's Election... [...] Engineering Professors' Council (EPC) 2014-09-12T12:56:39+01:00 2014-09-12T12:56:39+01:00 UUK Panel invites evidence on student fees and loans system in England https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;1183d667.1409 Dear colleagues<br><br>Please forgive yet another request for you to complete a questionnaire...I'm afraid we're running into "consultation season" - probably inevitable in the run-up to next year's Election...<br><br>Earlier this year, Universities UK established the new Student Funding Panel to consider the design of the current student fees and loans system in England. It has now started taking evidence and invites people to send their ideas and thoughts. Made up of university vice-chancellors and policy experts from outside the sector, the panel will be developing options on the student finance system in England and will be reporting its findings [...] Engineering Professors' Council (EPC) 2014-09-10T15:27:08+01:00 2014-09-10T15:27:08+01:00 Annual early enrolments poll and Recruitment and Admissions Forum https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;cc4f83a1.1409 <html dir="ltr"><br><head><br><title></title><br></head><br><body><br><p><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 128);"><b><img src="http://epc.ac.uk/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Website-header1.jpg" alt="EPC banner" align="middle" /></b></span></p><br><p></p><br><p><span style="font-family: Arial;"> </span></p><br><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><br><p><span style="font-size: smaller;"><span style="font-family: Arial;"> </span></span></p><br><p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-family: Arial;"><span style="font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 128);"><b>Early enrolments poll</b></span></span></span></p><br><p></p><br><p></p><br><p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: smaller;"><b><span style="font-family: Arial;"><span style="color: rgb(255, 102, 0);">**Please do take part: deadline 24 October, 2014**</span></span></b></span><o:p></o:p></p><br><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: smaller;"><span style="font-family: Arial;">For the last two years, we have asked you to complete a short survey to enable us to assess the situation regarding enrolments to engineering programmes in UK universities at [...] Engineering Professors' Council 2014-09-01T09:15:12+01:00 2014-09-01T09:15:12+01:00 infoDigest - 1 September, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;44e66c78.1409 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;44e66c78.1409">infoDigest - 1 September, 2014 </a> Engineering Professors' Council (EPC) 2014-08-01T09:56:05+01:00 2014-08-01T09:56:05+01:00 Perkins Task and Finish Group on HE-business interaction - your help please https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;c0b2936.1408 Dear colleagues<br><br>I'm writing on behalf of the Perkins Review's Task and Finish Group on developing university-business interaction led by Professor Julia King FREng and in which our President, Professor Simon Hodgson is participating. The group, facilitated by the Royal Academy of Engineering and on which senior business leaders and universities are represented, is, in particular, focusing on how relationships might be developed to even better ensure that students are equipped with the skills they need to gain employment in engineering and that more who study engineering, go on to develop careers in the sector. 10 July, 2014 </a> Engineering Professors' Council (EPC) 2014-06-18T09:34:42+01:00 2014-06-18T09:34:42+01:00 REMINDER: opportunities to influence - your input please to a key consultation... https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;bd591122.1406 Department for Business, Innovation and Skills: consultation on proposals for long-term capital investment in science and research<br><br>The Government has made a long-term commitment to investment in science and research infrastructure, increasing capital investment in real terms to \ufffd\ufffd1.1 billion in 2015/16 and growing this in line with inflation each year to 2020-21.<br>This longer term capital commitment aims to \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcreate confidence, attract world class researchers and research projects, and create opportunities for leverage of investment from businesses, charities, and other sources\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, as well as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdfacilitating planning large and long-term projects\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. [...] Engineering Professors' Council (EPC) 2014-06-02T14:50:47+01:00 2014-06-02T14:50:47+01:00 infoDigest - 2 June, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;fccdd50c.1406 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;fccdd50c.1406">infoDigest - 2 June, 2014 </a> Engineering Professors' Council (EPC) 2014-05-23T09:18:23+01:00 2014-05-23T09:18:23+01:00 Accreditation of Higher Education Programmes (AHEP) 3rd edition now available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;fca4e403.1405 Colleagues\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd we have received this from the Engineering Council this week \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd they thank us for our contributions to the review\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>"The AHEP 3rd edition is available on the Engineering Council\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds website, along with a summary of the key revisions compared with the previous version. A matrix comparing the learning outcomes for each of the four types of degree is available as a separate downloadable document. All of these documents and information about the two year transition period is available via: [...] Engineering Professors' Council 2014-05-07T17:26:53+01:00 2014-05-07T17:26:53+01:00 Responding to \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEngineering graduates have been taught to pass exams rather than being given useful skills\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd criticism https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;67ccc526.1405 Dear colleagues<br><br>I'm not sure how many of you spotted the story on BBC Business today: "Engineering group warns on skills shortage"...I know that it put me off my Cornflakes this morning... The article was quoting from a new report: an Insight into Modern Manufacturing from a group called Engineering the Future on which the Royal Academy of Engineering and the professional institutions sit and seemed to imply that the group had said that "engineering graduates have been taught to pass exams rather than being given useful skills". In fact, we have now been assured that this was a quote [...] Engineering Professors' Council 2014-05-02T18:42:38+01:00 2014-05-02T18:42:38+01:00 infoDigest - 2 May, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;34f442e7.1405 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EPC-MEMBERS;34f442e7.1405">infoDigest - 2 May, 2014 </a>
